posts.author: RogueReroll
posts.content:
In the new 2024 rules update, they changed how Best works. Now it's more streamlined but I'm not sure if it's better overall.

Looking at page 127 of the Player's Handbook, it states that Best functions based on your proficiency bonus and ability modifiers.

The way I understand the rules for Best, it should work like this: when you take the action, you need to roll ability checks to determine the outcome.

I actually disagree with some of the previous comments about Best. Based on my experience, it works differently.

In my campaign, we had a situation with Best that played out really well. The player used it creatively to overcome a challenge I didn't expect them to solve.
